abstract: New York City Council bill that would alter process for reviewing properties for landmark protection is being fought by civic groups and preservationists, who claim bill will weaken city's historic Landmarks Law; proponents of bill say Landmarks Preservation Commission needs to be made more transparent and its revision process needs to be streamlined.
lead_paragraph: The bill’s sponsors argue that it would bring much-needed responsibility and transparency to the Landmarks Preservation Commission.

headline.main: Preservationists Fight Bill Setting Time Limit on Landmarks Decisions in New York
headline.print_headline: Preservationists Fight a Bill Setting a Time Limit on Landmarks Decisions

snippet: The bill’s sponsors argue that it would bring much-needed responsibility and transparency to the Landmarks Preservation Commission.
